newsitem.title: FRANCE: Elf buys back 2 mln Elf shares sold by Axa.
newsitem.headline: Elf buys back 2 mln Elf shares sold by Axa.

text.p: Energy group Elf Aquitaine said on Friday that its Financiere Valorgest and Sogapar subsidiaries have bought a block of two million Elf shares, or 0.7 percent of the capital, sold by Axa-UAP subsidiary UAP-Vie.

"Financiere Valorgest and Sogapar, both indirect subsidiaries of Elf Aquitaine, are to acquire a block of Elf Aquitaine shares representing 0.7 percent of the capital of Elf Aquitaine as a long term investment from UAP-Vie, which decided to dispose of 2,000,000 of the 8,222,243 shares of Elf Aquitaine held by Group Axa-UAP," Elf said in a statement.

"Following the end of the preemption right period which the stable shareholding group of Elf Aquitaine benefits, or on June 4, 1997, all the shares which have not been preempted will be acquired by Financiere Valorgest and Sogapar," it said.
A spokesman for UAP said the Elf shares were sold at 590 francs apiece but declined to say at what price they were bought more than two years ago.
On Thursday Elf said Financiere Valorgest was buying back 2.5 million Elf shares, or 0.9 percent, sold by Renault SA.
At the time of Elf's privatisation in February 1994, institutions paid 411 francs per share for Elf stock, a Renault spokeswoman said.
